name: rob
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence: The terrorists financed themselves by robbing banks. My wallet's gone! I've been robbed! They robbed the company of $2 million.

to steal somethingstealI caught him trying to steal my bike.takeSomeone took their car from outside the house.shopliftHe was caught shoplifting by a security guard.robHe robbed a bank.burgleUK When she got home from work, she discovered that her house had been burgled.pilferEmployees pilfering paper, pens, etc. can cost employers a lot.
See more results »
C2 If someone is robbed of something they deserve or want, it is taken away from them: A last-minute injury robbed me of my place on the team.
More examplesFewer examplesThey were robbed of all their savings.Police said the couple had been trussed up and robbed before being shot.He was robbed while he was on holiday.He was robbed of his wallet and car keys.That was when I realized I'd been robbed.
